content: harvest moon pumpkins by kiki geiger harvest moon ˈˌhärvəs t ˈmo͞on noun 1 the full moon that is seen nearest to the time of the autumnal equinox the harvest moon gets its name from the extra light it gives farmers which mean in times before electricity that they had even longer to harvest their crops like pumpkins kiki geiger designs ● © october 2019 kikigeigerdesigns blogspot com ● ravelry kiki geiger ● thebrowndog etsy com materials yarn 1 skein worsted weight for the main pumpkin body plus a small amount of worsted weight for stem and blossom end at base can also be done in any weight yarn for a larger/smaller size pumpkin needles us 7 4 5mm dpns always use at least a size smaller than yarn usually calls for so stuffing doesn t show through notions tapestry needle polyester stuffing sizing size 4 across for size 4 worsted 10cm orange pumpkin below 4 ¾ for size 5 yarn 12cm cream pumpkin below gauge 14 sts = 10 cm for size 4 yarn 12 sts = 10 cm for size 5 yarn notes pumpkin is knitted in the round and stem is knitted i-cord style the blossom end is optional but a nice touch do before sewing stem on you can also sew a button on for the blossom end i used yarn abbreviations k - knit kf&b knit front and back increase k2tog knit 2 together decrease *…* - repeat what is between * s sts - stitches kiki geiger designs ● © october 2019 kikigeigerdesigns blogspot com ● ravelry kiki geiger ● thebrowndog etsy com pattern pumpkin cast on 7 stitches and join in the round without twisting stitches round 1 *kf&b* 14 sts round 2 and all even number rounds k round 3 *kf&b* 28 sts round 5 k round 7 *kf&b k1* 42 sts round 8-26 k round 27 *k1 k2tog* 28 sts round 29 k round 31 *k2tog* 14 sts stuff pumpkin until it looks like a ball fiqures 1 & 2 round 33 *k2tog* 7 sts cut a 24 tail and thread yarn needle draw through the 7 live sts and cinch closed stem change yarn to stem color this is knitted i-cord style cast on 4 sts and knit for 6 row cut yarn leaving a good tail and cinch live sts to bind off to construct pumpkin segments thread needle on the long tail of the pumpkin go through the center and out the bottom to draw down the pumpkin to a squashed shape go ahead and knot both tails together at the base before proceeding now bring the long tail around the outside of the pumpkin and back through the top hole figure 3 cinch tightly and this will make the 1st segment repeat opposite side to divide the pumpkin into two equal halves figure 4 do 2 more segments in each half until you have a total of 6 segments blossom bottom optional if you omit this step sew
